intro: Thamnochortus stokoei, commonly known as the Stokoe's restia, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in Mediterranean climates. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with numerous tiny white to pale blue flowers. It is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species.
